RHESUS incompatibility 
• Rapid rhesus (D) blood group testing must be done on all pregnant women at the first antenatal visit, or at
del
ivery in unbooked mothers. Rhesus-positive mothers need no further specific management.
• If a mother is rhesus-negative*, send blood for atypical antibody testing at 26, 34 and 40 weeks (six weekly,
align with the BANC visits):
o if no antibodies are found, continue with antibody testing every six weeks
o if antibodies are found at a titre of
